privilege_escalation_methods.name: Exploitation of Service Misconfigurations
privilege_escalation_methods.description: Identifying and exploiting misconfigured services or daemons that have excessive privileges.
techniques: Abusing service accounts with high privileges

privilege_escalation_methods.name: Scheduled Task Abuse
privilege_escalation_methods.description: Creating or modifying scheduled tasks to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

privilege_escalation_methods.name: DLL Hijacking
privilege_escalation_methods.description: Exploiting the search order of dynamic link libraries to load a malicious DLL.
techniques: Placing malicious DLL in search path
Modifying registry to change DLL search order

privilege_escalation_methods.name: Token Manipulation
privilege_escalation_methods.description: Manipulating access tokens to impersonate other security contexts.
techniques: Creating a token with higher privileges

privilege_escalation_methods.name: Bypassing User Account Control (UAC)
privilege_escalation_methods.description: Using various methods to bypass UAC and gain elevated privileges.

privilege_escalation_methods.name: Pass-the-Hash
privilege_escalation_methods.description: Using captured password hashes to authenticate as a user without the plaintext password.
techniques: Passing hashes to authenticate to network resources

privilege_escalation_methods.name: Kerberoasting
privilege_escalation_methods.description: Exploiting the Kerberos protocol to crack service account passwords.

privilege_escalation_methods.name: Exploiting Vulnerable Software
privilege_escalation_methods.description: Leveraging vulnerabilities in software to escalate privileges.
techniques: Privilege escalation exploits in system services
